title: Definitions
context: [ยง334D-2] Definitions. As used in this chapter, unless the context requires otherwise: &ldquo;Board&rdquo; means the board of nursing. &ldquo;Chemically dependent&rdquo; means a condition wherein a nurse&rsquo;s cognitive, interpersonal, or psychomotor skills are affected by the habitual or intemperate use of alcohol or drugs, or both. &ldquo;Diversion program&rdquo; means a program administered by professionals to assist chemically dependent nurses in obtaining evaluation, counseling, monitoring, and ongoing support for rehabilitative purposes. &ldquo;Nurse&rdquo; means a person who has been or is currently licensed under chapter 457. &ldquo;Peer assistance program&rdquo; means a program administered by professionals for the purpose of assisting nurses who are chemically dependent in obtaining evaluation, counseling, monitoring of progress, and ongoing support for rehabilitative purposes. &ldquo;Professional association&rdquo; means a national or statewide association or committee of professionals, or a nonprofit organization operated in support of a professional association that is recognized by the board and designated to administer and monitor the diversion program. [L 1993, c 106, pt of ยง1]
